properties.name: scroll-start
properties.value: [ auto | start | end | center | left | right | top | bottom | <length-percentage [0,∞]> ]{1,2}

values.name: <length-percentage [0,∞]>
values.prose: ... Negative values are invalid. Values corresponding to a length greater than the width/height of the scrollport are valid, but clamped to the width/height of the scrollport.

values.name: auto
values.prose: Element is used to calculate the scroll-start position, taking into account scroll-padding or scroll-margin , same as a scroll-snap target.

properties.name: scroll-start-x
properties.percentages: relative to the corresponding axis of the scroll container’s scrollport
properties.computedValue: the keyword auto or a computed <length-percentage> value

values.name: <length-percentage [0,∞]>
values.prose: ... Negative values are invalid. Values corresponding to a length greater than the width/height of the scrollport are valid, but clamped to the width/height of the scrollport.

values.name: <length-percentage [0,∞]>
values.prose: ... Negative values are invalid. Values corresponding to a length greater than the width/height of the scrollport are valid, but clamped to the width/height of the scrollport.

properties.percentages: relative to the corresponding axis of the scroll container’s scrollport
properties.computedValue: the keyword auto or a computed <length-percentage> value

values.name: <length-percentage [0,∞]>
values.prose: ... Negative values are invalid. Values corresponding to a length greater than the width/height of the scrollport are valid, but clamped to the width/height of the scrollport.

properties.computedValue: the keyword auto or a computed <length-percentage> value

values.name: <length-percentage [0,∞]>
values.prose: ... Negative values are invalid. Values corresponding to a length greater than the width/height of the scrollport are valid, but clamped to the width/height of the scrollport.

selectors.name: :snapped
selectors.prose: The :snapped pseudo-class matches any scroll snap targets, regardless of axis. The longform physical and logical pseudo-class selectors allow for more finite snapped children styling as they can target an individual axis.

selectors.name: :snapped-x
selectors.prose: Matches the child snapped on the horizontal axis.

selectors.name: :snapped-y
selectors.prose: Matches the child snapped on the vertical axis.

selectors.name: :snapped-inline
selectors.prose: Matches the child snapped on the inline axis.

selectors.name: :snapped-block
selectors.prose: Matches the child snapped on the block axis.

warnings.name: auto
